newsitem.title: EGYPT: Mubarak sends condolences to Israel over bomb.
newsitem.headline: Mubarak sends condolences to Israel over bomb.

text.p: Egypt's President Hosni Mubarak sent condolences to Israel's president after a deadly bomb attack in Tel Aviv, and said that violent acts and killing the innocent were not conducive to peace.
Egyptian newspapers and television on Saturday reported without detail the telephone conversation between the two leaders, whose countries signed a peace treaty in 1979.
Mubarak has played a role in peace negotiations between Israel and the Palestinian Authority.
Tension has been high since Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu sent bulldozers last week to begin a new Jewish settlement in the occupied West Bank.
Egypt said before the work started that it would be insensitive and damaging for Israel to break ground on the settlement in East Jerusalem after so much Arab protest.
On Friday a Palestinian suicide bomber killed himself and three Israeli women in the attack at a Tel Aviv cafe.
The militant Hamas group said it was responsible.
